stories.text: I don't understand why there is an expiration date on exercising stock option grants.  Anyone have a compelling reason why this even exists?  Seems to force stock option holders to 1) Make decisions when they aren't necessarily ready to and 2) Take on tax burdens before they ever see a payout.
stories.title: Expiration date on exercising options – total BS?
SpatiaLite: Extends SQLite core to support Spatial SQL capabilities

stories.text:
I'm one of those people who switch besties every 2 years.

My latest just broke up with me when they realized I don't consider them a bestie (but they did consider me a bestie).

My longest bestie-ship: 2 years. The shortest: 1 semester.

Please define BESTIE however makes sense to you. I consider a BESTIE to be whoever I think about the most when I don't think about myself (FYI I have no biological children).

I'm being deliberately vague so I can get a wide variety of responses.
stories.title: Ask HN: How many people switch besties every 2 years?
Oliver Blume Follows Herbert Diess as Chairman of the Board of Volkswagen
Apple re-enables Bluetooth on every OS update on purpose
Ask HN: What could software developers do for climate change?

stories.text:
Someone once told me an anecdote that startups focused on building tech products for legal use-cases have major hurdles.

Is there truth to this?

If so, what are the hurdles?

What are some success and failure stories you know of?

What are some companies to watch right now?
stories.title: Ask HN: Legal Startups
We Transitioned from Sprints to Basecamp’s “Shape Up” Methodology
